availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Mary Blain. Father of Erasmus Blain, James Blain, Thomas Blain, Robert Blain, Jesse Blain, Lucy V. Blain, Alice B. Blain, Sophia Blain, Napoleon Blain, Melissa Blain, and Pamela Blain. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 298B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 157.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 217A.
"Alexander Blain (1808-1886)," Memorial #75718161, Find A Grave, accessed July 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75718161.
